derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'certification, attestation'): from French certificat or medieval Latin certificatum, from certificare (see certify)

entry.def: A certificate is an official document stating that particular facts are true.

entry.tran: 结业证书;合格证书;文凭
entry.def: A certificate is an official document that you receive when you have completed a course of study or training. The qualification that you receive is sometimes also called a certificate .

example.ex: To the right of the fireplace are various framed certificates.
example.tran: 壁炉的右边是各种镶框的证书。
教育学研究生毕业证书

means.word_mean: 1. a document attesting to the truth of certain stated facts
2. a formal declaration that documents a fact of relevance to finance and investment; the holder has a right to receive interest or dividends;

stems_affixes.word_buile: cert搞清,区别+ain表示形容词→搞清楚的→肯定的
certain[adj.肯定的]+ty表名词→n.必然,肯定;必然的事
cert搞清,区别+itude状态→确定状态
con共同+cert搞清,区别→一致,和谐→音乐会
cert搞清,区别+ify表动词→搞清楚→证明

Sentence.sentence: You need proof of citizenship, either an old passport or a birth certificate and three photographs.

jushi.english: I happened to find my driving certificate.
